Title: How Many People Actually Help The Homeless?
Location: Lostock Hall, North West England, United Kingdom
Description: There are 58 000 homeless people in all areas of Los Angeles. You see them in small tents  benches on the side of the street  or under freeways  regardless of weather conditions. They struggle to survive with no clothes  food  money  or support. There are many people who stare and do nothing  despite feeling pity for them. However  there are also people who decide to help by donating clothes  giving away food  or giving them money to buy things they need. Although we like to believe that there are services and volunteers who help the homeless  the 16 000 homeless shelters in Los Angeles are not enough to help them all. But the real question is: how many people are really helping the homeless? We decided to survey students about their willingness to help those in need. Andres Villalobos gives to the homeless and believes that helping them is important  especially when they are veterans. He said  “when I have 10 dollars in my pocket  I usually give it to them or I just go into the nearby store and buy them food.” He believes it is sad that there are people that are veterans –served their country– and are rewarded with homelessness. On the other hand  there are some who think differently of homeless people and believe they simply do not deserve a helpful gesture. Sophomore Joseph Perez said he does not donate to the homeless because he does not carry enough money with him. When asked how far he was willing to go to help a homeless person  he responded by saying “Not that far…honestly.” If he was to be put in the same shoes as a homeless person  he would simply “Get a job.” His personal opinion towards homeless people is that  “It’s 50/50 for the homeless people who just do drugs. [You shouldn’t] help them… But the people who actually can’t work [because of a disability]  I think they deserve a chance.” Similarly  junior David Barreras said  “It sad seeing them but like at the same time I don’t because there is a reason why they got to that place.”Some  though  were willing to go far as starting their own business to help them. Freshman Ashley Rivero said  “Well when I grow up I want to start my own business and give them shelters — not like nasty shelters  but [shelters] with their own beds and shared rooms and good food.” She feels sorry for them and when she sees them  she has the urge to help them” David believes that students should be more involved by building programs to work together and help those in need. He says he does not really help the homeless  though  because he rarely ever sees one. If he did  however  he said “I would just give them food or blankets… I would start looking for opportunities or I would just get a job… You can make like programs like after school so we could gather up kids and then you could go on to Downtown… so all the kids that are in that program can give them stuff that they need.” David believes that the issue of the increasing homeless population can be solved if everyone worked towards achieving a solution. David said “they all deserve not to be homeless.”Not only do students believe that helping is important  teachers do as well. “I use to help in a soup kitchen to help feed the homeless” said 11th grade Chemistry teacher Ms. Roselman. She said she is willing to volunteer to help at a shelter for the homeless. “If I was a homeless person ” she said  “I would try to get those remedy services of having a government funded bed at a shelter.. I don’t think you have a choice of what is available to you and everything is kinda full so you just have to survive.” Ms. Roselman believes that many of the homeless do not deserve their current situation. She described one occasion saying  “I was able to talk to homeless people in downtown who were very social. Some of them were part of families who could not take care of them anymore or went through financial stress and couldn’t afford any kind of housing.” In the end  Ms. Roselman agrees that it is very sad and heart wrenching to have such a great number of homeless in Los Angeles and across the country. Overall  students believe that helping the homeless is a good way to give back to people because not everyone deserves to be in that situation and people would expect the same gesture back if they were in their shoes. In the end  coming together to help the homeless can bring joy to their lives.

Title: SUNDERLAND SOUP KITCHEN & FOODBANK FUNDRAISER 2019
Location: Sunderland, North East England, United Kingdom
Description: Christmas is one of the toughest times of the year for lots of people. Whilst many families over-indulge during the festive period  others struggle to put even the most basic meal on the table to feed their family - a harrowing reality of where Britain is at in 2019.    At the heart of Football is community  and at the heart of community are good people willing to dedicate their time and money to supporting those in need. No one wants to rely on food banks or soup kitchens to feed their children  but while we may feel powerless to fight the institution that has caused his hardship  we can fight to bring a modicum of security to the most vulnerable by giving a few spare coins or an hour of our time over to a cause like this. Where people would otherwise face malnourishment  food banks are the flickering flame of a beacon in an otherwise dark night.    The people at the Sunderland Foodbank and the Sunderland Community Soup Kitchen do an amazing job of ensuring that families and homeless people all over Wearside don’t go without - but unless people assist with their kind donations  none of it is possible.    Whatever you can give  it all helps.    - We have chosen this year to support the Sunderland Community Soup Kitchen and the Sunderland Foodbank  with all donations going to the two organisations. Please give generously - support your local community at this difficult time.    - On Wednesday 11th of December we will proceed with distributing the funds to the two charities  who will use the money this Christmas to feed the hungry and homeless in Sunderland. Sunderland Community Soup Kitchen feed people seven days a week and will now be able to buy pallets of fresh produce to cook with  whilst the foodbank will be able to use the money to produce emergency three day food parcels.

Title: Lost in Brixtons campaign for Brixton Soup Kitchen
Location: London, Greater London, United Kingdom
OrganizationDetails: Registered nonprofitDonations eligible for Gift Aid.
Description: Brixton Soup Kitchen is community space for homeless people or people in desperate need. The Soup Kitchen provide hot meals and warm clothes  drink and companionship in a warm and friendly environment on a weekly basis. Since 2013 we have served over 125 000 meals either eaten on site or distributed during food drop offs and outreach sessions around London and the UK.    Unfortunately for us the service was designed to maximise social contact for those most vulnerable in our communities who were feeling lonely  isolated and invisible. As a result of the current pandemic we have had to move away from that model and adapt it so as to limit social contact while still providing the basic essentials. This has meant that instead of having the centre open and serving hot food on site  we now have built up a database of vulnerable people (through both old and new referrals) and have been delivering both hot food  non perishables  freezer food  food packs and other essentials to those most affected by the current emergency. All our volunteers take precautions including wearing PPE and leaving parcels on the doorsteps

We are currently looking for some fuding to help us launch a project called ‘Brixton on Trial’  which will launch next summer (date to be confirmed). We wish to include local ethnic minority lawyers  businesses  students from local secondary schools and members of the public in a mock criminal trial dealing with the above issues.    The trial itself will seek to educate participants on both the processes and procedures of stop and search and a criminal investigation and trial.    We would be most greatful for all donations made towards helping us launch this programme next summer.     Many Thanks    Twanieka Alcindor- Founder   Lawyers In the Soup Kitchen

Description: 1.  Islay is a remote island of the West coast of Scotland with a population of 3500 people. The Covid-19 virus has hit island life hard with local businesses small and large having to close. The vulnerable and elderly are following Government guidelines meaning they are isolated in their homes . But  Islay is a strong community and we have over 80 volunteers that are helping to keep people’s physical and mental health strong by telephone befriending  collecting shopping  medicines and being a point of contact. Our newly formed resilience group coordinates the volunteers across the island reaching even the most remotest crofts and houses.        2.    We need a fund to:  Put fuel into the community bus  cover volunteer expenses  supply hand gel and gloves to our volunteers and eventually all households  and to cover admin and printing expenses. As the effects of the lock down persist  then we would like to provide people with a welfare box of essential items including food  kindling and toiletries.   Islay doesn't have access to mainland services so this fund is vital for us to get through the next few months.     3.    We visualise these funds being used in the immediate future for equipment to help the volunteers help the isolated but in the future weeks  we will need the fund to sustain the service and add a possible soup kitchen to enable the isolated to have two hot meals a day.    4.    The community of Islay  as we always do  has shown an excellent community spirit and will continue to pull together to ensure their neighbours who are isolated have everything they need to survive through this pandemic. Islay is resilient and will endeavour to push the barriers to make sure we will be open again for business as usual as soon as we can. This financial support will enable the immediate support of equipment  volunteers costs to be cover  offering hot meals to people at this hard time.    5.    You will be able to measure this through the huge smile and massive ‘socially distanced’ hug which comes through  helping a neighbour  friend or family member who is isolating and cant access their normal routine due to the pandemic. The number of volunteers is increasing every day  people as they have become unable to work have shown great support to help people who cannot leave their house. We will be forever in debt to the massive amount of generosity of time and supplies (physical and financially) from people and businesses. We hope we can open our doors to you all again very soon! Thank you in advance.    GC

Title: Turning the tide on TB: Supporting the San Bushman
Location: Ringmer, South East England, United Kingdom
Description: The San people of southern Africa  believed to be the longest surviving culture on earth by tens of thousands of years and the last tribe on earth to pursue the persistence hunt  have faced centuries of oppression and marginalisation. The Ju’/hoansi  the San people living in the Nyae Nyae Conservancy  now face a critical struggle against tuberculosis  a treatable and preventable disease.     This crowdfunder aims to raise money to support local efforts to beat this disease. The money raised will pay for projects which provide vital food  information and testing which is necessary to eliminate TB and support good recovery. The projects had a private funder  but she recently died  and government and NGOs have not picked up the funding shortfall. In addition  the collapse of tourism in the Nyae Nyae due to COVID19 has caused a major fall in local income  meaning this crowdfunder is more important than ever.       The San culture is under threat from many directions  but TB is particularly dangerous. It is the leading cause of death from any infectious disease worldwide and there are four strains of TB in the region. We’re working with organisations and doctors on the ground the Nyae Nyae to make sure this money gets to the right people at the right time.       The priority is to provide food for recovering TB patients as eating regular good food is essential for the treatment to work. Government funding pays for medicines distributed by the clinic in Tsumkwe  which serves the whole of the Nyae Nyae. However  this funding does not provide accommodation or food. There is a separate soup kitchen project which provides nutritious meals twice a day in Tsumkwe to TB patients  but it is facing massive funding cuts. The soup kitchen urgently requires £500 a month to continue to provide this vital service.     Funding is also desperately required for an outreach team that carries out testing and education in the remote villages. As we've learned from COVID19  testing is an important part of controlling infectious disease. The outreach team can identify the disease in the early stages  which limits the spread of infection within the villages. This outreach team requires £300 a month to operate.    Since TB flares up when people are malnourished or otherwise immuno-compromised  the longer term aim is to tackle food security. One vision to do this is to support the San to create gardens and food forests within each of the 39 villages in the Nyae Nyae Conservancy. Seeds  fencing materials and tree saplings are needed to establish a garden in each of them. If we exceed our fundraising target  the additional money will be put towards these gardens and forests.     If you are able to help fund this work in the longer term  please get in touch by contacting Caspar through the link below.       More on the San    The San people of the Kalahari are the last trace of our deep ancestry  our oldest cousins who never left Africa. Their territories span Botswana  Namibia and South Africa. In the last few centuries the nomadic lives these people led have been dramatically transformed through waves of colonialism and marginalisation that has put pressures on their land  and many are now settled in villages or only semi-nomadic.        Amongst the San are some of the best trackers and hunters in the world. Men and women can still walk into the bush with their digging sticks and come out with forage hides laden with food. However  their shrinking territory and the fact that they are settled in villages  means living off foraging and hunting alone is not enough. Money  necessary to supplement limited hunting and foraging  is hard to come by. The main sources of income are searching in the desert for the Devil’s Claw plant and tourism. With COVID19  it will be a long time before tourism returns to the Kalahari.     About us    We are a group of people passionate about supporting the Ju'/hoansi as many of us have spent time with them through the Old Way and / or Wildwise over the last few years. There is so much we can learn from a culture as old as humanity itself and we would love to support the people who shared so much with us. Your kindness means the world to us  thank you.    The Kalahari Action Group

Title: ZIMBABWE COVID19-EOMG HOMELESS SUPPORT FUND
Location: Eccles, North West England, United Kingdom
Description: COVID19 PANDEMIC RESPONSE TO HELP THE HOMELESS    COVID19 is destabilising economies and threatening humankind  it has been declared by World Health Organisation as a global pandemic. Zimbabwe is not spared  having recorded our first case rising to 3 As we post this. We have one confirmed death  and one death is already one too many. We believe the numbers are more than this and its just a matter of time before the situation explodes. Our health system is broken and definitely not ready. But again we are called to ACTION  to help wherever we can. In most cases the homeless community is always ignored as already experienced. There has not been any awareness amongst this community  soup kitchens around town have closed down  they don't have any access to healthcare facilities. With the lockdown being effected by the government - do we even think of where they will go? What they will eat? And how will they get treated if they contract the virus.     As EatOut Movement and our big following of volunteers in Zimbabwe and globally we are stepping in to do something no matter how small.     We are asking you to please donate to our fundraising campaign  WE ARE ONE! We chose this name because this disease has no boundaries  race  religion or status. We are in this together and let's do our best to help those most vulnerable especially the homeless.     ~We also appreciate the frontline workers  they are amazing we call them angels because of the sacrifice they are putting by risking themselves. Across the world Doctors  nurses have died whilst helping those affected and our team in Zimbabwe is not spared. They need protective gear  essentials to use and food to eat on this time. WE ARE ONE campaign aims to provide essentials for both our the homeless community and frontline workers. ~    Food (ready to eat)  Sanitizers   Gloves   Masks   Headcovers   Water  Temporary Shelter for the Homeless   Others     Visit our Facebook page for more info    https://www.facebook.com/eatoutmovement/    EatOut Movement Global is a social impact organisation dedicated to ending homelessness one life at a time both locally and globally. Title: Keep Spin City Alive
Location: Kintbury, South East England, United Kingdom
Description: In March 2020  Spin City (along with other gyms  dance studios and fitness venues) were told to close doors by the government in order to reduce the spread of Covid-19. Spin City Newbury actually closed before this request was announced as we felt the health and safety of our instructors and students needed to come first. As many can imagine  closing the doors to the business has been very difficult and emotional for us all. Unfortunately this has become even more difficult over the last few weeks when after exhausting all options available to us  it has become clear Spin City will not be entitled to any government help.     Spin City Newbury offers a range fitness classes including Pole  Silks  Aerial Hoop and Yoga  but Spin City is more than just a fitness studio. The studio offers a community where our students feel accepted. Students don't just come for the fitness classes  they come to meet new friends and take time away from the stress that is general life. Many students find that the studio helps their mental health and that the sense of achievement that naturally comes with our classes can help focus on a positive attitude towards health and fitness.     Spin City also has always possessed a strong desire to help the local community. Last year it held it's first summer ball where just short of £3000 was raised and donated to Mind  Berkshire Women’s Aid and Newbury Cancer Care. At the time of closing Spin City Newbury had just started organising this years ball with the intention of beating this huge amount. Along with this  Spin City regularly held Pole and Aerial 'jams' where students could come along after donating money to local soup kitchens/charities.     Katy and the entire Spin City team have always had a fiercely positive attitude  but at the moment the future isn't as positive. As a team we have started thinking of ways that we can adapt in these difficult and unprecedented times to allow us to get back into the studio teaching the classes our students love so much!    There are a few ways in which people can support and keep the studio alive.   There is the Spin City Patreon (Remember to put Spin City Newbury as your studio) This is pre recorded content that you can add together to build your own workouts. Memberships start at £10 per month and the proceeds are helping to support the studio while our doors are closed.   We will also be launching some specific classes which you can join in at home - details are being finalised at the moment  but we hope that this will bridge the gap for those wanting to workout at home but need a bit more motivation from an instructor for the class.   And lastly there is this crowd funder. This is aimed at anyone who would like to help support us  but isn't interested in getting lessons in return.   Anything you can donate is hugely appreciated and absolutely everything will be going into paying for the studio while we all are staying at home  staying safe and protecting the NHS.     From all of the team at Spin City Newbury - Thank you for your support.

Title: Preethis Volunteering
Location: Hucknall, East Midlands, United Kingdom
Description: My name is Preethi Perera  in 2016 I’m giving up my day job  putting all my worldly possessions in to storage  packing my backpack and embarking on an expedition to help people and communities around the world!     Why am I doing this?     We are incredibly fortunate in the UK to have high standards of living  in comparison to other areas of the world. We have an education system  health facilities and a freedom of speech that other countries simply don’t have.    I don’t want to go into another country and tell its residents how to live. I want to visit communities and share my knowledge  experiences and use my skills to help others.     I didn’t just wake up one morning wanting to do this. It has come from a lifetime of travelling and interacting with different communities around the globe.     I recently went travelling in The Gambia in West Africa. I visited a number of different communities and spoke to them about the struggles that they face on a day-to-day basis. I spoke to women about how they were viewed in comparison to men and how they had to stay at home while the male family members went to school/work and witnesses the frightened faces when AIDS/HIV was discussed because they didn’t understand it or how to stop it.   I also visited villages that have no water or electricity  but seemed so much happier than a lot of people in the western world who by comparison have it all.    How am I going to do this?    I didn’t just want to raise money through fundraising activities. The problem with that is you can’t always guarantee that the money you give to a charity will go directly to the people you want to help and support.    I made the tough decision to pack up my things and to go on a journey to help others in some of the worlds most deprived countries.    Following hours of research  I discovered International Volunteer HQ and Original Volunteers that works closely with NGOs across the globe. They identify where help is most needed and source volunteers with the right skills who can make a tangible difference in those areas.    After more research I found more organisations who can help me on my quest to make a real difference. Please see my itinerary below…    My itinerary    My first stop is Goa  India  whilst in Goa I will be working with the charity ‘Volunteer in Goa’ supporting local orphanages and animals.    From Goa I will travel Bengaluru to be involved in a women’s empowerment project with the Sankalp Volunteer Group.    My last stop in India is Chennai  helping women with learning disabilities alongside Original Volunteers.    After six months in India I will be flying to Cambodia for 3 months to work on community development  human rights  HIV & AIDs awareness  gender and environmental issues with International volunteer HQ (IVHQ).    After Cambodia I will cross the border to Vietnam to work on a project that focuses on feeding the homeless through local soup kitchens for 2 months.    I love animals  so through POD Volunteer I will be working in a dog and cat rescue sanctuary in Thailand.    I will then visit Kampala in Uganda for 20 weeks to help with women’s education  HIV and AIDS support and numerous construction and renovation initiatives.     Two months in Tanzania will consist of HIV and AIDS support in the local community.    My penultimate destination will be Zambia for another two months. Whilst there I will be delivering care to elderly residents and community development.    My two year trip will conclude with a 20 week programme in Ghana teaching childcare and agriculture.    Thank you for reading and thank you for any donation you may have given.    Pre xxx

Title: The refugee trail: Emergency funds
Location: London, Greater London, United Kingdom
Description: Dear friends    Your help is needed urgently!      As an independent volunteer here in Greece the most important thing I've been able to do is provide aid in crisis situations exactly at the time it was needed. That is why it is very important for independents to be here. To fill in gaps. You see NGOs  because of the way they are set up  although they have the funding and the resources  their hands are tied by a million different rules and regulations  which stops them from being able to react quickly to crisis.         But independent volunteers work differently. They arrive  they assess the needs and they provide direct aid as and when it is needed. This can mean doing a midnight run to the super market and buying 2000 croissants because the borders are closed and 80 buss loads of hungry and cold people are stuck at a gas station. Or driving a van full of equipment  for 6 hours   to set up a portable soup kitchen next to said gas station. It means arriving at 4am with tents and sleeping bags  making sure children and vulnerable people don't sleep in the open air in the middle of winter. It means being able to fly a very sick child to a mainland hospital in the middle of the night. And so much more.         But for this to happen we need funding. Money that can be accessed immediately. We need to be able to respond quickly. And we need your help. After nearly 3 months here I have had the absolute privilege of meeting and working with some of the most incredible human beings for whom personal safety and comfort is secondary to the welfare of others. They don't stop. They work 17 hour shifts in the cold or the heat  at the beaches  at the borders  in the towns. They pitch tents in the middle of a field with a gas cooker and make tea or soup  anything to provide warmth and comfort. They take over abandoned buildings and renovate it and turn it into safe spaces where people can eat and sleep and get much needed relief from their relentless suffering.         If you think this work is important and would like to offer your support  please donate generously. Tell your friends and family about it. It's because of your care and trust in us that we are able to do what we do.                                             What we need money for:    To hire vans  we need to buy kitchen equipment  food  blankets  sleeping bags  tents and everything else people need to survive the cold and the inhumane conditions forced on them by this situation.      100% of your donation will go toward providing relief to the refugees. We do not discriminate between war refugees and economic migrants. We do not differentiate between different nationalities. We only priorotise based on who has the greatest need.      For more info  updates or if you want to contact us go to: www.facebook.com/TheRefugeeTrail/        I thank you in advance for your kindness and generosity.       Sincerely    An independent volunteer

Title: Monkey Bizzness Hockley's Super Santa Appeal
Location: Hockley, East of England, United Kingdom
Description: Thanks for visiting and supporting Monkey Bizzness Hockley's Super Santa Appeal!    This campaign started as an October 2020 half-term project to supply 1000 packed lunches to vulnerable children in South Essex  and we raised nearly £1 800 on top of what we needed to get these lunches made. Because of the government's recent announcement that they are going to increase funding for the provision of 'free school meals' over the school holidays (well done Marcus Rashford!)  we have decided to use the additional money and hopefully loads more to make sure that lots of children in Essex have gifts to open on Christmas morning.    Like many hospitality businesses in England  we are closed until December 2nd 2020 and we're going to be brutally honest - financially we are struggling. However  across the UK the pandemic has led to many  many families struggling as well. While we are trying our hardest to stay afloat  a heartbreaking number of parents are going into Winter juggling keeping their children fed and their homes warm. You don't need to be an expert economist to realise that even a small amount of festive magic could be out of reach for many. This list of partner groups will expand in the weeks ahead. Title: Homeless Support Group: Glasgow
Location: Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom
Description: 2020… A horrendous year for many on different levels. Job Losses  Financial Impact  Mental Health  Isolation and for many Homelessness.    For the past couple of year  I’ve said I’d go out and do my little bit to help those less fortunate during Christmas and this year being the horror show that it was I decided no excuses  it’s getting done. I took to Amazon  purchased items such as Hats  Gloves  Socks and some other little essentials and made up 20 care packages coupled with some packed lunches  nothing extravagant… sandwiches  chocolate  some fruit and a few other bits and bobs.    The difference that made to people who were out on the street  sleeping rough  homeless  in temporary Accomodation or who have a house but are out begging to try and make enough to get their heat and electricity on for a day. I have seen these people. I have spoken to these people.    I knew after doing it I was hooked  not for the good feeling it gives you when you help others (just being honest…it does) but for the simple fact that there are a group of vulnerable people within the homeless and rough sleeping community who do not use the services of organisations such as soup kitchens for one reason or another. They vary but I am not there to judge. A lot of rough sleepers do not want to be hooked to substances and drink so going to a location with 100+ individuals who they may know  have history with and could tempt them isn’t a great idea  so they avoid it and are deprived of the support and network of a lot of amazing people.    So  where do my friends and I come into this?    We go into the City Centre 3 times a week (if we can) sometimes its two. We look for people who are begging or out sleeping rough and engage with them  try to understand their situation and then we provide them with a food parcel  a warm drink  and the most important thing of all our time. We chat to them.    Ideally  we aim to help around 10 people per night  we have around 6-7 regular people we go to visit  and we just know where they will be.    We are currently funding everything ourselves weekly but would love to be in a position where we have a fund there to help mitigate the cost of the food and consumables. I’ve roughly calculated that approx. £6k allows us to do this for the full year at a basic level as we are doing.    This is where I hope you can come in to help. Even sharing this will be a huge help but should you be able to donate anything (and I mean anything... 50p…£1 anything then it would be greatly appreciated.    I am also happy to hear from anyone who may have items they no longer need such as Jackets  Trousers  Socks  Hats  Gloves  Scarves  Sleeping Bags  Rucksacks  Boots.... I am happy to come and collect items from anyone who has anything they feel would be ideal to donate. I believe there is a contact organiser function on this page.    We are not an organisation; we are not a charity we are just a few people who understand there is a group of vulnerable people within a larger group of vulnerable people and we just wish to play our little part alongside all the other fantastic people out there.    Thanks for reading     Brian

Title: NOTHING BUT LOVE
Location: Hartlepool, North East England, United Kingdom
Description: So what exactly is the campaign I hear you ask? We are aiming to raise £2000 in a short period of just two weeks to ensure that each and every family in Hartlepool who are in need of a little help at Christmas receive a Christmas gift. Can you imagine  as you sit at home this evening surrounded by your Children who have probably already written their Christmas lists and sent them off to Santa not receiving a single gift on Christmas morning? Unfortunately this is a reality for families in our home town but YOU can change that by making a donation. I am going to be working very closely with Childrens Services at Hartlepool Borough Council to ensure that we target families that are most in need. I may be slightly ambitious here but the hope is the target will be smashed and and any funds left over will be given to the local soup kitchen and food bank in their 'leaner' months of January and February.    A local business man who wants to remain completely anonymous came up with the idea of 'The Nothing But Love' campaign. Wanting to give something back for absolutely zero in return he wanted to give a £1000 of his own cash to go to local families who are in genuine need but without any 'thanks' or shouting from the rooftops just wanting to do a selfless  good dead. The idea of the 'Nothing But Love' Campaign was born.    So of course want to donate  right? Well  here is the catch - You give COMPLETELY ANONYMOUSLY. That's right  you get absolutely nothing in return other than the warm glow inside of knowing you have done a truly brilliant thing. We ask that if you donate to the page you just pop your initials in rather than your name. We like to think of it as people helping people. We are hoping that local business people will look to donate very generously. If you are unable to donate if you could share the Facebook page with anyone who you think may be able to support that would be very much appreciated.    Thank you for taking the time to read and please help me spread the word to ensure we make it the best Christmas we can for everyone in our local community.    Janine    #nbl #givingforgivingsake #ifyouknowyouknow

Title: Give Joan hope and a safe home!
Location: Stirling, Scotland, United Kingdom
Description: My sister Joan had a stroke in 2015 and is paralysed on her entire right side. She has also lost a good part of her short term memory. Joan is confined to a wheelchair as she can not walk on her own. She has a caregiver who comes daily to care for her.     Sadly Joan has just been forced into homelessness and is temporarily living in a motel in Kelso  Washington. This happened just after Christmas because she was short rent money but didn’t want to ask for help as it was Christmastime. Sadly she was evicted and didn’t realise the implications and the cruelness the landlord would show them. Now she will have great difficulties finding a landlord that will accept her because that eviction is on her record.     My nephew Joshua  who has learning difficulties  also lives with my sister. Joshua takes care of his mom at night when her caregiver is not able to be there. He also has a job at the local McDonalds that he's very proud of as it's so hard for him to get a job with his difficulties. Unfortunately  because Joshua is an adult  he was made to be on the lease for the apartment as well. This means unfortunately that the eviction is on his record too.     Joshua’s young son  my great nephew Oliver  lives with them as well. He’s a bright kid that is the star football player for his school. Oliver helps look after his grandma too and he just adores her.     The three of them are sharing a handicap room and sadly the boys are sleeping on the floor.     Becoming homeless  let alone my sisters stroke  has affected them all something terrible and they are stuck! They are good people who’ve never drank  smoked or been anywhere near drugs.   My sister and nephews are the kind of people who would give you the shirt off their backs.     My sister was a stay at home grandma. She’s raised my great nephew Oliver when he was abandoned by his mother at 3 months old.   Joan used to make cookies and bake all the time and boy could she crochet! Her blankets and scarves were so beautiful!   She also used to volunteer at a local church who ran a soup kitchen. That came to an end when she fell off a pallet in 2014 whilst volunteering and broke her hip! Only a few months after this she had her stroke. Joan has had a horrible run of luck and I just want to turn it around for her and really show her how much everyone cares!     My sister receives very little help from the state and doesn’t get housing just because she’s a disabled stroke victim as most would assume. My great nephew is obviously a minor but the government doesn’t provide quick assistance for this reason either unfortunately.     They have applied to the local housing authority for subsidised housing but the waiting list is two years! Things are so different in the USA compared to the UK. The government WILL NOT help them!     We have exhausted all efforts  called all the shelters and spoken to the local churches. It seems so many people are in this position in the USA that no one has the ability to help!     Please help raise money for Joan and my sweet nephews to have a safe place to stay for the time being. The money will be going towards keeping them in the handicap room for now so my sister can be comfortable and close to her caregiver. Any additional money will be saved for a deposit for an appropriate home for them and any essentials they require.     If anyone knows of a landlord in Kelso or Longview that is willing to help them please let me know. We really need a miracle to happen! With your support and spreading the word hopefully we can find something for them soon!     Anything you can give now will be much appreciated. Even £5! Please share with everyone you know! Thank you all so much in advance!

Title: Pip’s Medical Fund
Location: Middlesbrough, North East England, United Kingdom
Description: Life Limiting or Life Threatening? Will my wife become paralysed? This year has been the happiest year of our life and the scariest too! After a long struggle my wife and I finally became parents  and we couldn’t have been happier. Until at 36 weeks pregnant my wife’s specialist disclosed his fears  that my wife condition could be life threatening rather than life limiting. He fears that Pip may have one or more components of the triad comprising Chiari Malformation  craniocervical instability and/or tethered cord associated with her chronic health condition. You see my wife has a condition called Ehlers Danlos Syndrome causing faulty collagen that we only believed to be life limiting. Until now Pip has had a full and exciting life  serving in the Royal Navy  studying to be a nurse as well as an extraordinary amount of voltunteer work. She became a qualified leader in scouting and guiding  ran a soup kitchen for 2 years  has sponsored many family’s through Christmas’s and back into employment. When Pip sees a family or a person in need  she can’t help but help  does collections  donates her things and she’s even give the shoes from her feet! She is an amazing  inspirational person as well as a new mum. My son needs his mother  and if she does now have a life threatening condition  I need to know so I can get her treatment. NOW So I’m asking our network of friends to please help us. Unfortunately the scan required for diagnosis is an ‘Upright MRI Scan’ of the cervical lumber spine which will establish if she has any of these conditions. This comes at a steep cost and adding on travel to the Medserena Scanner and to see the UK specialist after the scan we need to raise £2000. The NHS does not own an Upright MRI Scanner and therefore is unable to offer the test required  hence having to pay privately for the scan she has been referred for. Pip wants to enjoy being a mum  but as you can imagine; with this hanging over her head it’s a very emotional time. If you can make a donation or help with a fundraiser  we would appreciate it so much. You can make donations via PayPal. After everything that has been thrown at her over the last 6 years she has fought through to defy all odds. She’s living every second to the max  even starting her little business from home 3 years ago (Pip’s Embroidery UK) when many people would have just given up on employment. She deserves to know  so that she has the chance to try and seek a treatment. Please help my wife  my sons mum. John & Harrison

Title: FCC Bedford Church Building
Location: Clapham, East of England, United Kingdom
Description: After many years of renting properties for places of worship and our various Social Action Initiatives  Faith Community Church and our Charity Arm  Faith Community Project (1111208) of our own accord  successfully raised the finances to purchase  what is formally known as St Martins Church Hall  in Clapham Road  Bedford and now begin the task of renovating it for 21st Century use.      The building is situated immediately west of this historic town centre  within the historic town of Bedford; well known for being the home to the likes of preacher and writer of the acclaimed book ‘Pilgrims Progress’  John Bunyan  Edward the Elder’s first known castle fortress and Barony of Bedford.     The building is located on the A6 (Clapham Rd) which is easy to get to regardless of which route into Bedford you are taking. The building is placed between St Martins Church and Livingstone School as well as being a short and enjoyable walks to the beautiful Bedford Park.    Use of the Building    The intention for the building is primarily to be used as a place of worship for ‘all nations’ within the community of Bedford. F.C.C will also play host to a number of community initiatives such as a children’s and Youth activity centre  Meet & Chat Coffee Mornings  Soup Kitchen  OAP’s luncheon activity day  educational activities as well as a Performing Arts initiative. Once complete  the F.C.C building will stand as a beacon in Clapham road Bedford  bringing a fresh look to this area of Bedford.    How far have we come?    St Martins Church  after being unable to keep up with the maintenance of this building  eventually sold it to the council  which planned to turn it into a pre-school in coalition with Livingstone Primary School  which is its neighbouring building to its right. After promised money from government to improve schools were withdrawn  the council had no choice but to put the church hall back on the property market.    Being on the market for two years  we made some inquiries and after much debate about the condition of the property and its value  we managed to decrease the asking price from £250 000 to £70 000. We had managed to raise £82 000 and we were able to buy the property in 2013 cash for £70 000. At the end of 2015 we finally received planning permission for the refurbishment  partial rebuilding and extension of the old St Martin’s Church Hall  to create a significantly new  multipurpose community centre.      The official plans can be seen at the Borough Councils Planning Portal here:     http://edrms.bedford.gov.uk/PlanningBrowse.aspx?id=seZayNzlK66rbT8o9SOTWQ%3d%3d    Since obtaining Planning Permission  we have focussed on...    1. Raising as much funds as possible (£53 000 to date)    2. Putting a design team together  this consists of an Architect  Quantity Surveyor  Structural Engineer  Electrical & Mechanical Engineer and a Principle Designer (CDM) (as well as having integral input from all energy and power supply companies. This team alone will cost £16k circa.     3. Obtaining 4 builders quotes all ranging from between £500k to £1.5million    4. Writing to Funding Organisations  Churches and Individual Donors.     The design team are working hard to have the “Working Constructions Drawing” (Building Regs Plan) completed by Christmas 2016 to tender in order to Start work within the first quarter of 2017.    Among the core services we offer our community  we also aim to provide a range of high quality and cost effective services to the local community  with the potential to develop new services in response to the changing needs of the community. The many types of skill sets available through FCC affiliation as well as the many needs those skills sets aims to reach on a weekly basis  leaves us with no choice but to build upon what we already have  bringing what we do using four different location  under one roof.    Another part of our project that we are excited about involves working in partnership with Bedford Borough  local doctor surgeries and community services to pilot a volunteering ‘Community Health Champion’ service. Active ‘Health Champion’ models in action combined with the spiritual and emotional support churches offer across the UK have proven to be very successful; our aim is once the project has matured and gained the local communities trust  we will run a 24 hours support service for the emotional and mental needs of beneficiaries at the time their crisis occurs. Crisis can happen at any time  in the same way an individual with a broken leg or a heart attack shouldn't have to wait to see a doctor during office hours  those with emotional and mental crisis should have the same opportunities.     Mental and emotional health should have the same amount of care  thought and urgency  as physical health. As our building sits in one of the lowest deprived areas in the country  we aim to notably promote this unique service in this particular LSOAs (Lower Layer Super Output Area) which is among the 0-20% most deprived areas in Bedford and Kempston town.     Time banking’ (TB)  a way for people from all walks of life to ‘deposit’ their time in the TB by giving practical help and support to others  being able to ‘withdraw’ their time when they need something done themselves. TB promotes social inclusion and empowers individuals by making members feel valued  enabling them to share their skills with others learning new skills themselves.    Partnerships and effective community involvement is vital to ensure our project services and activities are a success. Involving local residents  particularly disadvantaged and vulnerable communities  in helping to design and deliver our projects and services will help build confidence  ownership and a sense of community. We are in the process of consulting with local council and professional organisations  such as TB UK regarding planning  implementation and sustaining our community service as well as contacting other similar projects to share and learn from their experience.     How can you get help?    With your help we can complete the renovations needed to establish the vision of Faith Community Church. FCC endeavours to contribute to meeting the needs of its community as well as foreign missions  but can only do this with your help.     We sincerely hope you will consider us for funding as we endeavour to impact our community long term.    Yours faithfully    Daniel Brown     Senior Pastor & Head Chair    On behalf all FTM Trustees    Faith Community Church    Bedford & Cambridge    Tel: 01234 352625    Mob:07411 295086      2016: Building  Growing & Establishing Victoriously

Title: I want to make a difference !
Location: South Shields, North East England, United Kingdom
Description: My name is Amelia Luffrum    My Life purpose – To make a difference    Covid has been a testing and trying time for us all; isolation and decline in mental health being two big issues. Through the loss  the change  the upside down-ness  I’ve moved into a new season with God.    At the beginning of the pandemic in March the Lord clearly spoke to me and asked me to do an online Life Coaching course for a year. Having plenty of time on my hands and being stuck in the house I took this as a great opportunity and said YES.    My Journey So Far    I am a visionary that has been used mightily by God. In 2002 I set up and ran ‘Hospitality and Hope’  a charity for homeless and vulnerable people in South Tyneside. I did this on a voluntary basis for a total of 15 years. I spent these 15 years following God’s guidance step by step. I set up a soup kitchen  which then became a charity  which went on to become a foodbank  clothing bank  supported living accommodation et al. This all culminated in me receiving a British Empire medal from the Queen and the charity winning the Queen’s Award for voluntary service. You can see the video of my journey of faith below.    Unfortunately  as a result of working 80+ hours a week   I then became ill. I took time out to recuperate and find myself; I had lost myself in the work. I visited two Christian retreats and it was at these centres that I encountered the powerful way that creativity could be used in the healing process. God can speak through anything; pictures  poetry  woodwork  needlework  gardening and more.    My Creative Journey Begins    It became apparent that my time in the charity was over. God had me on the next part of my journey. I started a creative group called Come to the Table. This group met once a fortnight. We gathered around a large table to eat  talk  pray and create. It helped many people in different ways. Connection and creativity worked hand in hand to help and heal. However  when the lockdown happened it was no longer possible to meet like this.    Creativity and Coaching    The Lord spoke to me one Sunday when I was in church (prior to Covid) and told me to offer someone one to one creative sessions. I had never done these one to one creative sessions with anyone before and the Lord had to ask me three times before I said YES. Before the first session I was very nervous and had no idea what to do. But God gave me a download of exactly what I should do and I was amazed at how the creative sessions impacted my client’s life. Every session since  God has given me the exact creative activity to do and I have seen healing and freedom come from these sessions.    My online coaching course required me to find two people to practice with. Straight away it came to me to ask the person I had been doing creative one to one sessions with. She said YES. And so Creative Coaching was born in my life.    Both my clients have been helped enormously through this process. Both of them had previously been to see counsellors and clinical professionals. But creative coaching offered something new and different that helped them to become free.    In this I have seen God work through me to reach others with long term mental health issues. I stand amazed. By word of mouth I have other people interested in doing creative coaching. I know the Lord is using me in a mighty way.     What Next?    What I need now in order to proceed and help many more people is a studio to deliver Creative Coaching. A self contained  secure  comfortable and readymade creative environment where folk can come and feel safe and get individual attention.     The studio comes in parts and is moveable so it is future proof!    I believe the Lord asked me to set up a Go Fund Me page and gave me the specific target figure of £17 000 to cover; the cost of a studio with electrics and the remedial work like clearing the ground and laying a flat base. This is really stepping outside of my comfort zone. I have again given God my YES and wait to see what happens.    I now need help in pursuing the next stage of my journey  again helping people but this time using coaching and creativity. After spending 15 years volunteering for the charity (1 year paid)  I feel God is wanting me to make this my ministry. Yes  I will be making a charge for this service  but up until now I have given freely of my time. I will continue to do free sessions for those who can’t afford to pay.    I have seen the results that creative coaching has had and relish the opportunity to help many more people. I want to pursue what really matters; the opportunity to help rebuild people’s lives. Some have been stuck for many  many years. To see the effects that creative coaching is having is absolutely astounding. Only God could do this.    Why would you sow into this?    You would not only be sowing into my life by providing a space to work from but also be sowing into the lives of others who need help to walk into freedom. This is a unique opportunity for you to make a difference in someone else’s life. Will you give it your YES?    I will be making regular updates and hope to make a video of the studio site before  during and after.    Please watch the short films of two people's accounts of how creative coaching has impacted their lives.    Thank you.    Amelia      Creative Coaching Client recommendations:    1:1 Creative Coaching Sessions  I have now completed 5 coaching sessions with Amelia. Each session has been specifically designed to address the coaching focus in question  and in my case involves a creative activity.  I have been astounded by Amelia’s ability to produce relevant activities which help me to focus on  and talk through  the issues in question. The process of creating makes it easy to share with Amelia the sometimes emotional aspects of the issues I am addressing. It particularly helps me to identify how I am feeling and what I believe and think about an aspect of my life. This then enables me to address and change any wrong thinking. Throughout this process Amelia brings wisdom and presents challenge in a safe  calm environment. I would highly recommend Amelia as a coach.  Beth     Life Coaching  When I first started this life coaching course with Amelia I had very little expectation of it being able to help me. I have been a Christian for a long while and have sought help many times with little or no results ( except disappointment) . However I can honestly say that in the weeks that Amelia has been coaching me  my life has turned around. I am beginning to think differently and I am acting differently. Amelia doesn’t say very much but she does listen and gives me pointers to direct my thoughts and feelings in alignment with the word of God. The visual things she gets me to do  although simple  they have a great impact on me. I am so thankful to God for allowing me to do this course with such a spirit filled loving person who genuinely cares for the people she coaches.   Many  many  thanks to Amelia for all of the time and prayers that she puts into helping me and so many others.  Rosie    I want to make a difference  A Poem Written by Amelia E Luffrum    I want to make a difference  To everyone I meet  I want to make a difference  To people in the street.    I want to make a difference  To everyone I know  I want to make a difference  Everywhere I go.    I want to make a difference  To friends and loved ones too  I want to make a difference  Especially to you.    I want to make a difference  To show I really care  I want to make a difference  A moment just to share    I want to make a difference  In the things I do and say  I want to make a difference  In a positive way. Title: Help Trevor get home
